info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Wallguard™ Dirt Resisting Latex is a new breed of latex paint that has a very high resistance to dirt, dust, smog, and mildew. It can be painted even in a rigorous environment where there is a very high concentration of airborne pollutants. It is suitable to be used in industrial areas and along highways. It is specially fit for repainting medium and high-rise buildings where the need to preserve a freshly painted look with less maintenance is of utmost importance.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is ideal as an exterior finish for newly constructed buildings as well as for repainting old structures.

info.title: FEATURES
info.body: BOYSEN®® Wallguard™ Dirt Resisting Latex is 100% acrylic. It is highly resistant to alkali, mildew, airborne pollutants and dust. It has good exterior durability and it resists fading, cracking, and peeling. It also has outstanding gloss retention due to its superior block and scrub resistance.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: New Concrete
info.body: Allow new concrete to dry for 14-28 days under normal weather conditions before painting. Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust, dirt, contaminants, and all loose grit and mortar. If neutralizing, treat surface with a solution of 1 part BOYSEN®® Masonry Neutralizer B‑44 diluted in 16 parts water, applying liberally by brush or roller. Let dry overnight before rinsing with water to remove white crystals that form on the surface. Let dry before painting. However, if the concrete has been cured for more than 28 days, there is no need for neutralizer.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Repainting
info.body: Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using BOYSEN®® Paint and Varnish Remover B‑141, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. For repainting concrete with chalky old paint, use BOYSEN®® Chalk Blocker™ B‑7304 as surface conditioner. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: New Concrete
info.body: Primer: BOYSEN®® Acrytex™ Primer B‑1705 Putty: BOYSEN®® Acrytex™ Cast B‑1711 Topcoat: BOYSEN®® Wallguard™ B‑5715 (2 coats)

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: Repainting
info.body: Topcoat: Apply two coats of BOYSEN®® Wallguard B‑5715 on properly prepared surface
